website_summaries.verdict: An average kiln set that comes with a few helpful accessories.
pros: Excellent for at-home hobbyists and jewelry makers
Fuses in a normal microwave oven
Comes with useful accessories to get started

customer_reviews.title: in my opinion this kit was a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife for Christmas and wish that I had not. We followed the directions exactly as they stated and the top stuck to the bottom, I managed to get it loose and found that the glass had melted and run over the side, nowhere in the directions does it state how long to continue the heating process once it glows orange, in my opinion this kit was a waste of money, the directions are useless and I believe it is of poor quality. I do not recommend this kit for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT as advertised, NOT a Fuseworks Kiln. It is some fake. It did NOT come with findings as advertised. Kiln paper does not protect the kiln and now kiln has gouges in it as the paper fused to the bottom of kiln. The glass is substandard compared to my friend's true Fuseworks kit. The glass cutter does not score properly unlike the one that came with my friends (real Fuseworks kit). Buyer Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Lynn E. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Not a true Fuseworks Kiln
customer_reviews.text: This is not a Fuseworks kiln in spite of the description. There is no Fuseworks logo labeling, the surface and inside textures are very rough compared to Fuseworks and it takes more than twice as long to fuse in a 1200 watt microwave. I have a Fuseworks and it takes 2:30 to fully fuse. This one takes 4:30-6:00 minutes in a strong oven. In addition the material is much rougher, the top center hole is wider and the inner grey material is thicker and rougher. It will work however, because of the long fuse times and I'm sticking with my original Fuseworks.
customer_reviews.author: PaulB

customer_reviews.title: Fun, no learning curve.
customer_reviews.text: This kit came with everything I needed to make several pieces that I could then turn into jewelry after getting findings and jewelry glue at the craft store. It worked perfectly in a normal microwave. I followed the directions, nuked the kiln for 6 minutes, cooled for 30 and it was done - a unique, melted glass piece.
customer_reviews.author: lasheliz

customer_reviews.text: I work with these Kilns all the time. Weekly at minimum so I usually by several a year to keep up with my workload. They are very convenient to use in the microwave and get a product done in 4 minutes. I love them and will always be a customer.

product_meta.title: BHD Professional Microwave Kiln Kit 10 Pieces Tools Set Fuseworks Beginner
product_meta.description: Learn to fuse glass right in your microwave oven. Fuseworks Microwave kiln is lined with a high tech composite material specially formulated to fuse glass in a home microwave. A metal-lined microwave between 800-1200 WATTS is recommended for best results. Create stunning pendants; fashionable earrings; snazzy bracelets and much more. Kit includes: Fuseworks microwave kiln; (7) 90COE Fusing glass assortment; one ounce Dichroic bits and pieces; one ounce Millfiori glass; one ounce Confetti glass; one each: silver and gold earring set; one each: large and small silver and gold bails; two pieces of kiln paper; glass cutter tool; one pair of hot mitts; and easy to follow instructions. Measurements: Kiln: 3-1/4-inch by 4-7/8-inch; complete package: 7-1/8-inch by 7-1/8-inch by 7-1/8-inch.
feature_bullets: Includes kiln, fusing, bits, glass, earring, bails, kiln paper, glass cutter, hot mitts and instructions(please be informed that the instruction booklet is for 15 pieces accessories kit)
Fuse glass in your home normal microwave oven
Measures 3 1/4" H x 4 1/2" D with an interior fusing platform of 2 3/4 ".
Great with kiln fired glass paints and Precious Metal Clay (PMC).
